intro: Maclura calcar-galli, commonly known as the rough-horned nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules. Maclura calcar-galli is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
